collapsing.label: Collapsing
collapsing.description: Defenders collapse toward the slot to protect high-danger areas. Forces low-percentage perimeter shots.
best_use: Against teams who attack through the slot (e.g., BUF, OTT, DET)
When your D pair is slower and needs support
risks: Elite shooters can walk in from the blue line if unpressured

staggered.label: Staggered
staggered.description: Hybrid zone designed to disrupt low-to-high plays and limit behind-the-net rotations. Strongest vs cycle-heavy opponents.
best_use: Against teams that run behind-the-net offense
When wanting good balance between slot protection and point pressure
risks: Can open space on the weak side if players rotate late
If gap control is poor, rush chances can develop
ideal_opponents: Teams with strong board play (DET, NYI, BOS)
Teams relying on low-to-high shot chains

tight_point.label: Tight Point
tight_point.description: Aggressively pressures the opposing defense at the point to prevent long-range shots and force quick decisions.
best_use: Against teams with elite offensive defensemen
When your wingers are fast and disciplined defensively
risks: Opens up the slot if coverage rotates late
Can be exploited by quick puck movement
Dangerous vs strong passers (e.g., Kane, Marner, Panarin)
ideal_opponents: Teams with elite point shooters (e.g., COL, NYR, WAS)
Teams that rely on point-driven PP or OZ setups

notes: Protect the slot and reduce high-danger chances
Pair with Protect Net or Contain Puck pressure
Pairs well with Contain Puck or Normal pressure
Pairs well with Puck Side Attack or High Pressure

cycle_dominance.trigger_reason: Opponent winning board battles and playing behind the net.

point_shot_flood.trigger_reason: Opposing defense taking too many clean point shots.

slot_invasions.trigger_reason: High-danger slot chances or net-front chaos.
